citeinfo.origin: National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA), Office of Oceanic and Atmospheric Research (OAR), Pacific Marine Environmental Laboratory (PMEL)
citeinfo.title: DART Station 46404 - D128: 45.86N 128.78W (PMEL Tsunami)

abstract.p: Sea level height data from DART Station 46404 - D128 at 45.86N 128.78W. Water Column Height is at 46404 meters. Events data are also provided if any are available. Data are recorded in pounds per square inch absolute (PSIA), but are displayed in meters after applying a constant 670.00 mm of water/PSIA conversion factor.

DART systems consist of an anchored seafloor bottom pressure recorder (BPR) and a companion moored surface buoy for real-time communications. An acoustic link transmits data from the BPR on the seafloor to the surface buoy. The data are then relayed via a GOES satellite link to ground stations, which demodulate the signals for immediate dissemination to NOAA's Tsunami Warning Centers, NDBC, and PMEL.
Real-time data is available at the National Data Buoy Center http://www.ndbc.noaa.gov/dart.shtml

descript.purpose: To provide deep-ocean tsunami measurements in real-time during an actual event.

idinfo.useconst: Contact the National Data Buoy Center.

distinfo.distliab: While every effort has been made to ensure that these data are accurate and reliable within the limits of the current state of the art, NOAA cannot assume liability for any damages caused by any errors or omissions in the data, nor as a result of the failure of the data to function on a particular system.
